generalfeedback.text:
In order to solve this problem we will have to use the quotient rule <hint>calc_quotient_rule</hint> as follows:
\[\begin{array}{rcl}\displaystyle \frac{d}{d@v@}\left(@p@\right) &\displaystyle =&\displaystyle \frac{\left[\frac{d}{d@v@}(@pp1@)\right]\cdot (@pp2@) - (@pp1@)\cdot \left[\frac{d}{d@v@}(@pp2@)\right]}{(@pp2@)^2} \\ &\displaystyle =&\displaystyle \frac{[@diff(pp1,v)@]\cdot (@pp2@) - (@pp1@)\cdot [@diff(pp2,v)@]}{(@pp2@)^2} \\ &\displaystyle =&\displaystyle \frac{@diff(pp1,v)*pp2@ - @pp1*diff(pp2,v)@}{(@pp2@)^2} \\ &\displaystyle =&\displaystyle \frac{@diff(pp1,v)*pp2-pp1*diff(pp2,v)@}{(@pp2@)^2} \\ &\displaystyle =&\displaystyle @factor(diff(p,v))@ \end{array}\]

truefeedback.text: To differentiate a quotient use the rule \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You cannot get the derivative of a quotient by dividing the derivatives.

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] It appears that you divided by $f^2$, not $g^2$.

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You used \[\frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g}.\]

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You used \[\frac{\frac{df}{dx}g+f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\]

truefeedback.text: To differentiate a quotient use the rule \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You cannot get the derivative of a quotient by dividing the derivatives.

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] It appears that you divided by $f^2$, not $g^2$.

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You used \[\frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g}.\]

You appear to have applied the quotient rule incorrectly.
It is \[\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f}{g}\right] = \frac{\frac{df}{dx}g-f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\] You used \[\frac{\frac{df}{dx}g+f\frac{dg}{dx}}{g^2}.\]
